stork.feather

Class Pipe

  • java.lang.Object
    • stork.feather.Pipe
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Sink, Tap

    public class Pipe
extends Object
    A base class for anything which can serve as an element in a proxy transfer pipeline. In particular, this is the base class for Sink and Tap.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Pipe.Orientation
      The orientation of a Pipe in a pipeline.

    • Method Detail

      • source

        public Resource source()
        Get the source Resource of the transfer.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if a Tap has not been attached.

      • destination

        public Resource destination()
        Get the destination Resource of the transfer.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if a Sink has not been attached.

      • tap

        public Tap tap()
        Get the Tap which this Pipe receives data from.
        Returns:
        The Tap, or null if none is attached.

      • sink

        public Sink sink()
        Get the Sink which this Pipe drains to.
        Returns:
        The Sink, or null if none is attached.

      • upstream

        public final Pipe upstream()
        Get the upstream Pipe attached to this Pipe.
        Returns:
        The upstream Pipe, or null if none is attached.

      • downstream

        public final Pipe downstream()
        Get the downstream Pipe attached to this Pipe.
        Returns:
        The downstream Pipe, or null if none is attached.

      • attach

        public Pipe attach(Pipe pipe)
        Attach pipe to this Pipe according to their orientations.
        Parameters:
        pipe - the Pipe to attach.
        Returns:
        The pipe being attached.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if pipe cannot be attached to this Pipe due to conflicting orientations.

      • orientation

        public Pipe.Orientation orientation()
        Get the Orientation of this Pipe in the pipeline. If a pipe is connected to just a Tap, it is tap-oriented. If a pipe is connected to just a Sink, it is sink-oriented. If it has both a Tap and Sink, it is connected. If it has neither, it is ambiguously oriented.
        Returns:
        The Orientation of this Pipe.

      • start

        protected Bell start()
              throws Exception
        Start the flow of data through the pipeline. This method returns as soon as possible. Preparation should be done asynchronously.
        Returns:
        A Bell that rings when data may start flowing.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if a Sink has not been attached.
        Exception - if the transfer cannot be started for a reason known immediately.

      • drain

        protected Bell drain(Slice slice)
              throws Exception
        Drain a Slice through the pipeline. This method returns as soon as possible, with the actual I/O operation taking place asynchronously. The default implementation is guaranteed never to throw an Exception. Any Exception thrown by a downstream Pipe will be wrapped in a Bell.
        Parameters:
        slice - a Slice being drained through the pipeline.
        Returns:
        A Bell that rings when the pipeline is ready for more data, or null if more data is ready to be drained immediately. If the returned Bell fails, the upstream Pipe should cease the draining of Slices.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this method is called when the pipeline has not been initialized.
        Exception - if Pipe is unable to drain slice for some reason known immediately. The default implementation will never throw.

      • drain

        protected Bell drain(Throwable error)
        Called when an upstream Pipe encounters an Throwable while draining. By default, this propagates the Throwable downstream for handling by the Sink.
        Parameters:
        error - a Throwable indicating what error occurred.
        Returns:
        A Bell that rings when the pipeline is ready for more data, or null if more data is ready to be drained immediately.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this method is called when the pipeline has not been initialized.

      • finish

        protected void finish()
        Finalize the flow of data through this Pipe. Calling this indicates the successful completion of the data transfer. Once called, no more Slices will be drained through this Pipe. It will not propagate the call until the last Slice has been drained.

      • finish

        protected void finish(Throwable error)
        Finalize the flow of data through this Pipe. This is called when the transfer of data by an upstream Pipe has failed. Once called, no more Slices will be drained through this Pipe. It will not propagate the call until the last Slice has been drained.
        Parameters:
        error - a Throwable indicating what error occurred.

      • pipeline

        public final List<Pipe> pipeline()
        Retrieve the pipeline as a List. This is intended to be used for debugging purposes primarily, and the returned List is purely informational. That is, modifying it does not affect the state of the pipeline. This may change in the future, however.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
